H0.text: Help patients spend less time in the emergency room can be achieved by increasing and revising scientific knowledge of different types of bacteria.

H1.text: Aid research students who are studying complex organisms is what scientists can develop by increasing and revising scientific knowledge of different types of bacteria.

H2.text: Help make medicines from newly discovered plants is most likely enabled by increasing and revising scientific knowledge of different types of bacteria.

H3.text: Develop specialized antibiotics that are directed at single‑celled organisms is what scientists will most likely develop by increasing and revising scientific knowledge of different types of bacteria.

A4.text: According to the WHO fifty one new therapeutic entities - antibiotics (including combinations), are in phase 1–3 clinical trials as of May 2017.

A5.text: These drugs did not address the entire spectrum of resistance of Gram‑negative bacilli.

A6.text: Similar to the situation in malaria therapy, where successful treatments based on ancient recipes have been found, there has already been some success in finding and testing ancient drugs and other treatments that are effective against AMR bacteria.

A7.text: Public health experts believe these budget reductions will adversely affect the development of new antibiotics as well as advances in diagnostics and treatment strategies, thus undermining efforts currently underway to address AMR.
